column4: I have google chrome installed, but it doesn't show in software center, how do I remove it completely?
how did you install it?
a .deb I believe
problem is, it seems chrome is broken since flash (and a bunch of other plugins) isn't installed there..
try doing "which chrome" (or whatever) to find the binary, then "dpkg --search <whatever which gave you>" to see if it tells you anything helpful?
this is what it returned; google-chrome-stable: /usr/bin/google-chrome
I seem to remember having to symbolic link the flash .so file into a directory for chrome to see it.
yeah?
yea had to do it on debian. looking for details now.
this isn't it, but try this to make sure: http://linux.chrissweeney.co.uk/topic.php?t=76
already did just that. it is non-existant
look for a /plugins directory in your chrome directory
there aren't any
yes
yea how did you install flash? I recommend you install that flashplugin-installer package. look to see if /usr/lib/flashplugin-installer/libflashplayer.so exists
just look to see if it's there. you might be running flash through some gnash half-bakery and that might be the breakage. :P
I try ;D
guess I gotta install flashplugin-installer then
https://www.adobe.com/software/flash/about/
it runs a small animation and tells you the version you are running
i know, hehe
you are my hero of the day
